title: Home and Away spoilers: Ben’s frustration boils over into drastic action
text:
Ben is tired of waiting around (Picture: Seven)

With Irene’s (Lynne McGranger) court trial steaming ahead, and Colby (Tim Franklin), Bella (Courtney Miller) and Leah (Ada Nicodemou) also present during the proceedings, these events have led Ben (Rohan Nichol) to feel more frustrated than ever with his own case. Still living in the caravan park and struggling to get through each day due to his depression and lack of purpose without his business, seeing Irene’s case progress more quickly has him feeling like he’s left in limbo.

Alf (Ray Meagher) sees Ben’s mood change and is concerned, as he hears him vent his frustration that he’s heard nothing good or bad from the lawyers or the AFP about his case. After losing his business, Ben’s Boards, and being forced to sell the Pier Complex to cover the costs of his defence lawyer, the lack of action is beginning to add insult to injury.

Ben tells Alf that the situation has him feeling he’s staring into an emotionless, dark void, with Irene’s case going ahead only making his feel more stagnant than ever. Although Alf advises him to try and make something for himself, Ben dismisses him, unable to see past his negativity.

Alf tries to talk Ben around (Picture: Seven)

When more news about Irene’s case filters through, Ben’s frustration boils over and he’s pushed into action. Alf and Justin (James Stewart) see Ben arguing on the phone with his lawyer, asking them for an update and if they can be more proactive. His heated argument leaves onlookers worried, and Ben then storms off.

He tells Alf and Justin that he’s going to make something happen for himself, but the two men are left wondering exactly what he has in mind – and if he’s even thinking straight. When time goes by and Maggie (Kestie Morassi) hasn’t heard from him, people begin to worry about what he might have done…
